column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: region. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .@prefix geo: <http://www.geonames.org/ontology#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.com/ontology#> .# A definition of a 'Region'ex:Region a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Region"@en ;    rdfs:comment "A geographic region or area."@en .# A definition of a 'Country', which is a type of 'Region'ex:Country a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Country"@en ;    rdfs:comment "A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territorial area."@en ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Region .# A definition of a 'City', which is a type of 'Region'ex:City a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "City"@en ;    rdfs:comment "A large and important town."@en ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Region .# Properties that a 'Region' can haveex:population a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "population"@en ;    rdfs:comment "The total number of people who live in a particular region."@en ;    rdfs:domain ex:Region ;    rdfs:range xsd:integer .ex:name a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "name"@en ;    rdfs:comment "The official name of the region."@en ;    rdfs:domain ex:Region ;    rdfs:range xsd:string .# Specific instances of regions - a Country and a Cityex:UnitedStates a ex:Country ;    ex:name "United States"^^xsd:string ;    ex:population 331449281^^xsd:integer .ex:NewYork a ex:City ;    ex:name "New York City"^^xsd:string ;    ex:population 8336817^^xsd:integer .```
